sn28.10:4.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn28.10:4.2: Then he got dressed in the morning and, taking his bowl and robes, entered Rājagaha for alms.
sn28.10:4.3: After wandering for alms to be consumed on site in Rājagaha, he ate his alms-food by a wall.
sn28.10:4.4: Then the wanderer Sucimukhī went up to Venerable Sāriputta
sn28.10:5.3: “Well then, do you eat facing upwards?”
sn28.10:5.5: “Well then, do you eat facing the cardinal directions?”
sn28.10:5.7: “Well then, do you eat facing the intermediate directions?”
sn28.10:6.1: “When asked if you eat facing all these directions, you answer ‘no, sister’.
sn28.10:7.1: How then do you eat, ascetic?”
sn28.10:7.2: “Sister, those ascetics and brahmins who earn a living by the unworthy pseudoscience of geomancy—a wrong livelihood—are said to eat facing downwards.
sn28.10:7.3: Those ascetics and brahmins who earn a living by the unworthy pseudoscience of astrology—a wrong livelihood—are said to eat facing upwards.
sn28.10:7.4: Those ascetics and brahmins who earn a living by running errands and messages—a wrong livelihood—are said to eat facing the cardinal directions.
sn28.10:7.5: Those ascetics and brahmins who earn a living by the unworthy pseudoscience of palmistry—a wrong livelihood—are said to eat facing upwards.
sn28.10:8.1: I don’t earn a living by any of these means.
sn28.10:8.2: I seek alms in a principled manner,
sn28.10:8.3: and I eat it in a principled manner.”
sn28.10:9.1: Then Sucimukhī the wanderer went around Rājagaha from street to street, from square to square, and announced:
sn28.10:9.2: “The Sakyan ascetics eat food in a principled manner!
sn28.10:9.3: The Sakyan ascetics eat food blamelessly!
sn28.10:9.4: Give almsfood to the Sakyan ascetics!”
sn28.10:13.1: The Linked Discourses on Sāriputta are complete.
